classic.name: Basilica of Notre Dame of Fourvière
classic.description: 19th-century basilica with 4 octagonal towers, a religious art museum & regular Catholic services.

classic.name: Théâtre Gallo Romain
classic.description: The substantial ruins of a pair of Roman theaters, now used for open-air concerts & festivals.

classic.name: Mur des Canuts
classic.description: Huge fresco of a neighborhood of silk workers who rebelled against working conditions in the 1800s.

classic.name: Musée Cinéma et Miniature
classic.description: Museum of hyper-realistic, miniature everyday scenes, plus movie props & special effects exhibits.

classic.name: Parc de la Tête d'Or
classic.description: Vast, 19th-century park with statues, fountains & tall trees, plus a lake & botanic & rose gardens.

classic.name: Cathédrale Saint-Jean-Baptiste
classic.description: Grand medieval cathedral with an astronomical clock & stained-glass windows, plus a treasury museum.

classic.name: Gallo-Roman Museum of Lyon-Fourvière
classic.description: Modern hillside museum on Roman archeological site with a large collection of art, pottery & coins.

classic.name: Musée Lumière
classic.description: Film museum, documentation center & library at the site of the Lumière factory, family villa & park.
classic.address: 25 Rue du Premier Film, 69008 Lyon, France

classic.name: Hôtel de Ville de Lyon
classic.description: This stately 17th-century landmark with 2 courtyards & an ornate interior now serves as city hall.
classic.address: 1 Pl. de la Comédie, 69001 Lyon, France

classic.name: Musée des Confluences
classic.description: Permanent & temporary exhibitions about anthropology & science amid dramatic, modern architecture.

foodie.description: Opulent riverside building that housed a hospital for many centuries, now planned for redevelopment.

foodie.address: 30 Cr de Verdun Perrache, 69002 Lyon, France

foodie.name: La Commune
foodie.description: Hip, industrial-chic food court & terrace, with changing stalls offering creative global cuisine.
